author: Special Correspondent
text:
Deputy Inspector General of Police K.Jegadesan said the cause of the murder is still not clear.- Photo : T.Singaravelou

Police on Wednesday arrested a 54-year-old man who is suspected to be the killer of the woman French national S.Hunorine, 68-year-old woman, a Puducherry-origin French national, was found murdered at her residence on Tuesday.

Familiar person

Deputy Inspector General of Police K.Jegadesan said, “We found that the woman was brutally attacked by a blunt object. There was no damage to any of the articles in the house. It seemed that only a person who was familiar with the house might have committed the offence.

After sustained investigation, we zeroed in one Thamas Saint Ethiyan(54), staff of Public Works Department. He was the last one to have contacted the family recently”

Mr. Jegadesan said during interrogation Ethiyan he confessed to the crime. It is said that there was verbal duel over a money transaction between the accused who was in an inebriated condition and the woman which culminated in a murderous attack on her, he added.

But still the cause of murder was not clear.

The woman was living in Puducherry after she was estranged from her husband twenty years ago. Her two adopted children were staying in France while she was living with her grand-daughter in Chinnayapuram.
title: Suspected killer of French national arrested
